message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient underwent liver transplantation and is receiving transplant rejection prophylaxis. Among the options, only Cyclosporine is commonly used as an immunosuppressant in transplant patients. Excessive hair growth and gum enlargement are side effects of Cyclosporine.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient had a liver transplant and is on transplant rejection prophylaxis, both of which suggest immunosuppressive drugs. Among the options, only Cyclosporine is known to cause excessive hair growth and gum hyperplasia.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient underwent liver transplantation and is on transplant rejection prophylaxis, so the most likely cause of her symptoms is one of the drugs used for that purpose. Among the options, only Cyclosporine is associated with excessive hair growth and gingival hyperplasia.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient underwent liver transplantation and was started on transplant rejection prophylaxis, which includes Cyclosporine. Cyclosporine is known to cause hirsutism and gingival hyperplasia, which are consistent with the patient’s symptoms.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient underwent liver transplantation and was started on transplant rejection prophylaxis. Among the options, cyclosporine is known to cause hypertrichosis and gingival hyperplasia, which are the patient's findings.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s symptoms match those of gingival hyperplasia and hirsutism, which can be caused by Cyclosporine, a drug used for transplant rejection prophylaxis. Daclizumab and Tacrolimus can cause hypertrichosis but not gingival hyperplasia. Methotrexate does not cause either.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Dark-pigmented, coarse hair growth and gum overgrowth are side effects of cyclosporine, which is used for transplant rejection prophylaxis. None of the other options are associated with these side effects.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient underwent a liver transplantation, and the most likely cause of the excessive hair growth and gum enlargement is cyclosporine, which is commonly used for transplant rejection prophylaxis. Daclizumab, Tacrolimus, and Methotrexate are not known to cause these symptoms.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient had a liver transplant and reports progressive enlargement of gums, indicating gingival hyperplasia. Among the given options, only cyclosporine is known to cause this side effect.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient had a liver transplant and is on transplant rejection prophylaxis, which suggests the use of immunosuppressive drugs. Among the options, Cyclosporine is known to cause excessive hair growth on the face and body as well as gingival enlargement.
